website_summaries.verdict: Gives you 13 amps of charging power, ensuring you can charge your 48V golf cart battery system quickly.
pros: Has a built-in safety system to prevent inadvertent overcharging issues
Includes a gauge built into the case, so you can see the exact level of charge being delivered
cons: Contains a retro design that won’t appeal to everyone

customer_reviews.title: Good charger for golf cart
customer_reviews.text: Let me start with what might be important to some of you. Charger will not restart once battery is completely charged. Not a charger for winter storage. Great price, arrived on time, good packaging. Easy to set up. Makes a fairly loud humming noise when it first starts and then settles down. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: May blow up!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this charger!! it was defected when we bought it I requested a refund within the amount of time I was allowed and they have yet to give me the refund which was eight months ago the charger continually charges if it is plugged into the golf cart it doesn’t know when to stop charging it just continually charges even though the battery would be full and we figured that out by walking out to our garage and smelling like the house is going to blow up. I think I have been more than patient enough with them
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Ganskop

customer_reviews.title: Will not work if batteries are completely drained.
customer_reviews.text: my second of these chargers, one for ergo and this one for club car. They work great
customer_reviews.author: Reuben W. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Bad product/bad business
customer_reviews.text: This product did not last 2 months and after contacting the company we were not offered a refund or replacement. Bad business and very disappointing. After being told that if the batteries are to low it will not charge . I charged every battery separately, that is not the case . This battery charger does not work and only worked 6 or 7 times . This charger I paid $200 is nothing but junk . Thanks Amazon for helping my throw $200 of hard earned money out the window .
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Good charger for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased my first golf cart and the charger that came with it went kaput so I purchased this one. I can’t believe how quiet it is when it’s charging. Have used it twice and no issues so far. I just notice that it gets a little warm while it’s in use, but I think it’s supposed to be that way.
customer_reviews.author: L. Logan

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one for my 2004 Club Car and it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Cronmiller

customer_reviews.title: Works on 48 Volt system
customer_reviews.text: Works great and was $100 cheaper on Amazon than the cart shops in Myrtle Beach!
customer_reviews.author: The bull

customer_reviews.title: Well made.  Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Saved us money. We thought the used golf cart we purchased needed new batteries. Luckily, it was only the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Txgal

customer_reviews.title: Lester Link Series 48 Volt Golf Cart Battery Charger 1995-2013 Club Car PowerDrive & Golf Carts
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this charger for our golf cart. I liked that it shuts off after the cart is fully charged. It is heavy to lift but otherwise, worth the cost!

customer_reviews.title: It worked as it should
customer_reviews.text: Worked just as it should received on time and in good shape

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my ClubCar charger.
customer_reviews.text: This charger works just like the original ClubCar charger. I am happy I chose this product for the price and ease of use. It also came with instructions that were very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Csonka

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the charger however it arrived slightly damaged do to poor packing.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality charger!
customer_reviews.text: This charger takes forever to charge my golf cart & my batteries don't hold the charge. I have brand new batteries & they worked just fine with my old charger. I would advise anyone to NOT buy this charger.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Harris

customer_reviews.title: Golf cart charger
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 2009 48 volt club car precedent.

product_meta.title: Lester Link Series 48 Volt Golf Cart Battery Charger for 1995-2013 Club Car PowerDrive & IQ Golf Carts
product_meta.description: This Lester Links 48 volt 13 amp golf cart battery charger is made for 48V Club Car Power Drive & IQ golf carts (DS & Precedent (1995-2013 ONLY)). It's a smart charger that prevents overcharging and undercharging your golf cart batteries. It comes fully assembled with the ClubCar 3-pin molded round connector plug. It replaces all PoweDrive, IQ, Delta Q, Lestronic II, DPI and Thunderbull battery chargers, model numbers: 17930, 17935, 17930-11, 17930-18, 17930-19, 22110, 1018022-01, CP6031, CP1018022-01, 26580, 26580-31, 26580-38, 26580-39, 26560.
feature_bullets: This Lester Links 48 volt golf cart battery charger is made for 1995-2013 48V Club Car DS, Precedent, Carry All, Villager & Transporter golf carts all PowerDrive / IQ & IQ Plus systems (Does NOT fit Star Carts).
Plug the battery charger into your Club Car and once your golf cart batteries fully charge, the Club Car's onboard computer automatically tells the charger to stops charging.

The Lester Links Charger needs a minimum of 30 volts to activate. If the battery pack is below 30 volts, the charger will not register when it is plugged into your cart and therefore it will not turn on.

If your batteries are less than 4 years old then you may be able to bring them up to the proper voltage. You will need to do this with an automotive style charger. YouTube has videos online to help you with this process.

This 48 volt Club Car battery charger made by Lester Electrical offers a 2 year manufacturer warranty but many customers have found that these heavy-duty intelligent chargers will last for more than 20 years.
